dialogues.text: Did a bunch of gay people put you up to this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does.   They KISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor sleeps peacefully with his limbs wrapped around Anna. Anna lays on her back, eyes wide open, STARING AT THE CEILING. She's clearly not at peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of Beth's sister's spouses - Steven, Devon and George - sit on the couch watching basketball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!    Take him out.   He's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.   This isn't some exhibition game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth comes downstairs, with another set of dirty dishes, and walks past them to the kitchen. The guys are annoyed that she blocks their view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anyone have time to run to the store?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, we're good. We just got drive through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, annoyed, goes into the kitchen. She puts down the dishes in shock. The kitchen is SPOTLESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to the sink and sees the back of a man, doing the last of the dishes. He turns around. It's NEIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dishes are all put away. There's a load of laundry still drying, but the other one is folded on top of the washer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the fridge, and OPENS it.    It's STOCKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remembered what your dad likes, but I tried to get healthy stuff, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth just looks at Neil, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben told me.    I just - I wanted to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, TEARS start to roll out of Beth's eyes. goes to her, and puts his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how much you love him.      But it's gonna be OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine pulls up in her Land Rover and gets out. As she approaches the house, she stops in her tracks. ALL THE SCAFFOLDING IS GONE. THE HOUSE LOOKS BEAUTIFUL. She whips out her cell phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javier - does this mean what I think it means? So when you say "done" - you don't mean "we still need plumbing in the upstairs bathrooms done" - you mean "done done"?...Wow - you're amazing...OK...I'll call when I see it...Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up the phone, steels herself, and walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Janine enters - she can't believe her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS as Janine walks from room to room - amazed. Where there once were plastic sheets there are now walls with vintage wall paper. All the floors are immaculate, the chandeliers sparkle - it's all perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks down halls and up staircases, past end tables and mantles - ALL COVERED WITH PICTURES OF HER AND BEN. Nice and tasteful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ends her tour in the master suite - it's HUGE. And though full of furniture, the longer she stands there, the more empty it begins to seem. Her face transitions, from delight to loneliness, within a matter of seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out her cell phone, hesitates, then dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT WIDE TO REVEAL: Ben sitting on a ledge in front of the gym, smoking a cigarette, watching the passersby. He's clearly waiting for Anna to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His PHONE RINGS. He looks at it - JANINE CALLING. He IGNORES the call, takes another drag of his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Janine as the call goes to voice mail. She hangs up, confused. She sits on the edge of the bed, looking around the room, not sure what to do with herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices a pair of pants and jacket thrown over a chair - goes to tidy it up. She picks up the jacket, checks the pockets, they're empty. She grabs the pants, takes them both to the walk-in closet. She hangs up the jacket. And as she folds the pants over - she HEARS SOMETHING HIT THE GROUND. She looks down to find -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PACK OF CIGARETTES. Her face pales. She stares at it - immobile. Her face tightens, her eyes well up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU LYING SACK OF SHIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as she grabs two armfuls of his clothes off the racks and flies out of the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAIRCASE - She hurtles down the stairs, throwing armfuls of clothes into the foyer. Then, she surveys the scene and, not satisfied, rushes back up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLWAY - As she flies back into the bedroom, she sees herself in the ANTIQUE MIRROR hanging in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without even thinking she grabs it from the wall and SMASHES IT on the ground. She stands over it, breathing heavily, looking at the shattered glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She EXITS FRAME and we hear her walk down the stairs, the camera HOLDING ON THE EMPTY WALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat we hear her walking back up the stairs - she ENTERS FRAME AGAIN holding a DUSTPAN AND BROOM. She kneels over and begins sweeping up her mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil lies on the bed, reading. The room is pretty messy - a lot of clothes strewn around. There is a KNOCK at the door. Neil gets up to answer it. It's Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a while since I've been here. Turns out - that boat in the next mooring, looks like yours -- not yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's no problem. Nice guy. Invited me in for a white wine spritzer. Not sure he gets a lot of visitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil ushers her in, shuts the door.    Beth looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to thank you. For coming by my folks' house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I really care about your dad. And I really love you. Even if I can't give you what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil looks at her - unsure of her meaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our life together is what I want. Your love is what I want. Did you see those guys my sisters are married to? You are a better husband to me - without being married - than any of those real husbands will ever be. And that's enough for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'd really be OK if we take the marriage thing off the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you promise to love me and be committed to me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always have -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I'm not done. And snake the shower drain when my hair clogs it, and let me eat Wheat Thins in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth smiles.   They KISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I get to move back in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.   But, you cannot bring those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to his pants - a RAGGEDY pair of CARGO PANTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You're just mad at me, and you're taking it out on the pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I gotta win something. I let you win the big battle, so throw me a bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. We're not getting married, but I'm chucking the pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.   We both win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigi sits on her bed, head flung upside down, blow drying her hair. The phone RINGS but Gigi doesn't hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, in his office, paces as he talks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Gigi. It's Alex. I was just wondering how you were doing. It's been a little while since we've talked -- and I was wondering how you were doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks up. Tyrone is watching him, shaking his head. Alex motions for Tyrone to leave. He doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I was hoping to talk to you. Obviously. But you're out. So, call me. Sometime. Or tonight. I'm around. OK. That's enough now. It's Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.   Tyrone is unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigi flips her head back - oblivious to the phone call - and checks her hair. She heads out of the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor and Anna climb the stairs of a three story row house. A "FOR SALE" sign is outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seriously get a ton of people bidding on this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's crazy. But it's a neighborhood "in transition."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that means what - that hip gay people want to live out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hip gay people, young couples, young families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor smiles as Anna heads into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird - it totally reminds me of the house I grew up in. I bet there is a -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna goes into a little nook off of the kitchen.   And pulls down a BUILT IN IRONING BOARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We totally had this same thing. My mom would use this as her 'desk'. Isn't that bizarre? It was always covered with her little coupons and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks up to Conor, who is just watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, when do all the fabulous homosexual couples start arriving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the open house is tomorrow. But I have this one buyer. I mean, I want to see if his girlfriend likes it first -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I had this idea -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor looks - all of a sudden - to be sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An idea for the open house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, an idea. For this house. For - me. To buy. And hopefully, if you like it and things continue to - you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna turns to face Conor, trying to put this together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna, look. I have a plan. I know where my life is going. And I want you to go with me. I mean - I'm not saying you have to move in now or anything - I just - I don't want to buy a place that you couldn't - at some point - see yourself moving into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor takes her hands in his.   Anna starts to PANIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think? I mean gut reaction. I always go with my gut when it comes to real estate or ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks at him. And at the PULL DOWN IRONING BOARD. She looks at the ironing board a long time, before turning back to Conor, holding back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this Conor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.   If it's too fast -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I mean this. Any of this. What you're saying - what you're offering - is what every girl wants. It's what I've always wanted. It's just -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks at him for a long time, not knowing how to say this. Conor looks at her, struggling, and suddenly sees it in her face. The answer he's been looking for. It all dawns on him in an instant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want it with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna NODS sadly.   Conor takes this in.   A LONG BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I have a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it too late to dial it back to before - and just keep sleeping together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna LAUGHS, and it breaks the tension.   Conor smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I thought that really -    you know - gelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna goes to Conor and HUGS him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your standard waterfront seafood restaurant. Gigi sits across from BILL, nice looking, if a bit conservative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Alex told me you work in finance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Yes, I do. Finance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nice evening. And you planned it. And called me when you said you would. And showed up on time. Thank you, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER AWKWARD LONG SILENCE.    Gigi smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex now seems pretty agitated. He's shirtless, his hair's a disaster. He's holding his phone handset. Staring at it. He can't stop himself. He dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey it's Gigi. You've reached my cell. I'm either having a very good time or in a meeting - either way just leave a message and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex hangs up. He stands there for a second, thinking. Then he runs into his bedroom like a madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigi and Bill stand awkwardly outside her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for a lovely evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill reaches out for an ill timed hug.   It's awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes inside, drops her stuff and sits on the couch. Then, A KNOCK on the door. Gigi reluctantly gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you forget something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the DOOR.    It's not Bill.   It's ALEX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?     What did you forget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex reaches into his pocket and pulls out a PEN. THE SAME PEN THAT GIGI PRETENDED TO BE RETURNING TO CONOR. Gigi tries, without success, to suppress a SMILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A speakeasy from the 1900s that hasn't changed much. A PIANO starts to play on a tiny stage - empty. And then - a terrified but determined Anna takes her place in front of the mic. And begins to SING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a "THE LAST GOODBYE" by JEFF BUCKLEY - barely recognizable - more of a torch song. As she sings, she begins to gain confidence. We hear the song over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Neil's place. Neil comes in holding a few MESSILY PACKED BOXES. He is clearly moving back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did all this stuff fit in here fine before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth comes in after him, holding some of his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It expanded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil collapses on the couch. Beth sits next to him, a pile of clothes on her lap. She looks down and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you are not trying to bring these back in here -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth holds the CARGO PANTS that she protested before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    I have no idea what you're -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a deal. These are not staying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really gonna free up a lot of space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going. I have a bag I'm taking to the Goodwill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil watches her, smiling, as she walks across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. You win. Just check to make sure there's nothing in the pockets before we give them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth dutifully puts her hands in the pockets. And then she FEELS SOMETHING. Her face registers curiosity as she pulls out - A BLACK VELVET RING BOX. Beth looks at it, and when she looks up - Neil's down ON ONE KNEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you so much. So much. I want to make you happy. I need to make you happy for me to even have a shot at being happy, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears stream down Beth's face.      Neil pops open the bo revealing an ENGAGEMENT RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you marry me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil gets up and KISSES HER. They kiss, passionately, for a long moment. And then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    Of course, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigi and Alex stand in her entry.     She holds the PEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came all the way here - at 11 at night - to give me back a promotional pen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I better come up with some excuse to get over here. Isn't that how it's done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks at Gigi for a long moment.    He looks nervous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I can't stop thinking about you. I drive by your place. I call and hang up. I'm turning into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, a wise person once told me that if a guy wants to be with a girl, he will make it happen. No matter what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. Because when I was hurling my body onto yours - you did not seem to want to "make it happen."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the thing about that. You were right. I've gotten so used to keeping myself at a safe distance from these women, having the power - that I didn't know what it felt like when I actually - fell - for one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigi considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've just been out with your friend Bill. And it just might be exactly what I need. No drama. He calls. He does what he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could do that stuff too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't. And that same wise person told me that I am the rule. That I have to stop thinking that every guy will change - stop thinking that I will be the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before she can finish her sentence, Alex KISSES HER. A LONG, SLOW, PASSIONATE KISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - that I will be the exception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my exception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to KISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A staple of summer in Baltimore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rickety Baltimore Blade float comes by. It's a very phallic "blade" with a A BUNCH OF YOUNG SHIRTLESS MEN dancing and waving. Mary rides the float, too, waving to the crowd with Nathan, Joshua and Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor, with a NATTILY DRESSED GAY COUPLE, stands on the street watching. Nathan calls down from the float.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you guys doing up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dancing.    Get your asses up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, the two Nattily Dressed Gays grab Conor, and climb up onto the float. They SHOUT over the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Conor. He just sold us on the most amazing duplex in Mt. Vernon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Conor.    I'm Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor looks at Mary and SMILES. All of the gay men around them start to DANCE. LIKE REALLY, REALLY DANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so great to finally meet you in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other.   Is there a connection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor takes her hand - and the two of them do an old fashioned slow dance on the float. As everyone freaks around them, they smile and dance in each others' arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben walks into the house and looks around - no Janine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he heads to the stairs, he stops in his tracks. At the bottom of the stairs - ALL OF HIS CLOTHES are stacked, neatly folded into piles. He approaches, then sees a CARTON OF CIGARETTES on top of one pile -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and a NOTE taped onto the carton: BEN - KNOCK YOURSELF OUT. - JANINE P.S. I WANT A DIVORCE. Ben slumps down, devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful sunny day on the harbor. Anna's song fades out, and the sound of Gigi's voice fades up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls are taught a lot of stuff growing up. If a guy punches you, he likes you. Never try to trim your own bangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out on the sparkling water, Neil's boat. As we get closer, we see garlands on the rails, on the bough. Even closer and we see - Beth on the arm of her father. He escorts her down a mini aisle. On the bough of the boat - is a TINY WEDDING. About six guests. And Neil, waiting for Beth at the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And someday you will meet a wonderful guy and get your very own happy ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary sits at her desk, typing on her laptop.   ON THE SCREEN: MARY'S MYSPACE PROFILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every movie we see, every story we're told, implores us to wait for it. The third act twist...the man who couldn't get it together finally figuring it out...the unexpected declaration of love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary hits a button and a box comes up, which reads: ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO DELETE THIS MYSPACE PROFILE? Mary clicks "YES". MYSPACE PROFILE DELETED appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a KNOCK ON THE DOOR. Mary gets up, grabs her little purse, and opens the door. IT'S CONOR. Mary smiles, her face barely able to contain her happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigi and Alex sit close on her couch, watching a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the exception to the rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN over to the TV to find that they are watching: SOME KIND OF WONDERFUL. Watts and Keith finally KISS. Gigi can't suppress her smile as Alex pulls her close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we're not taught is how to read the signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben heads to the checkout line - holding a six pack of beer and a bag of chips. As he's about to put his stuff down, a PRETTY GIRL gets in line behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How to tell the ones who want us from the ones who don't. The one's who'll stay from the one's who'll leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets her go ahead of him. She smiles, takes him up on it. The cashier rings her up, she pays for her stuff, without giving Ben so much as a look. Ben gives his stuff to the cashier, along with a weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the outside looking in a ground floor window - we can see the living room of the lower apartment. Boxes fill the room - clearly a new tenant moving in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine enters, carrying two boxes. She opens one, and pulls out the ANTIQUE MIRROR (now with new glass).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ultimately, we're not taught the one thing that could save ourselves, our friends, our families countless hours of confusion, despair, and speculation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs the mirror, straightening it slightly. She steps back, seems pleased. Then, IN FRONT OF CAMERA walk two people - the CAMERA FOLLOWS THEM down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see it's Anna, walking with a NEW GUY - it's clear it's a first date. They stop at the corner, exchange an awkward hug. As they turn to go their separate ways -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna smiles - the New Guy turns and heads off. Anna watches him go, and then turns and walks away from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sometimes the happy ending...is just moving on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna walks down the hill, the skyline of Baltimore in front of her.
